member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelCellAlignment.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate if the text automatically shrinks to fit in the available column width. When true the text can shrink. Default value is false.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart
member.summary: Represents a chart shape in a worksheet.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets the worksheet of this chart.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.DataSourceRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source range of the chart

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartType
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart type

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.SeriesByRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the chart series are created from the data source range rows or columns. The data source range can be specified when the chart is added to the worksheet. When this flag is true the series are created from rows otherwise from columns.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.LeftColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based left column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The left column is included in the chart area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.RightColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based right column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The right column is not included in the chart area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.TopRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based top row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The top row is included in the chart area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.BottomRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based bottom row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The bottom row is not included in the chart area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartLeftPositionPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the left edge of the chart area inside the worksheet. The left and right column indexes are adjusted based on the specified left position to keep the width. The left position is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartTopPositionPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the top edge of the chart area inside the worksheet. The top and bottom column indexes are adjusted based on the specified top position to keep the height. The top position is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartWidthPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the chart area. The right column index is adjusted based on the specified width. The width is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartHeightPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the chart area. The bottom row index is adjusted based on the specified height. The height is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartLeftPositionPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the left edge of the chart area inside the worksheet. The left and right column indexes are adjusted based on the specified left position to keep the width.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartTopPositionPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the top edge of the chart area inside the worksheet. The top and bottom column indexes are adjusted based on the specified top position to keep the height.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartWidthPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart area width in points (1 point is 1/72 inch). The right column index is adjusted based on the specified width.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChart.ChartHeightPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the chart area. The bottom row index is adjusted based on the specified height.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D
member.summary: Represents the rotation properties for a 3D chart.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.XRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the X axis rotation in degrees as a value between 0 and 360.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.YRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y axis rotation in degrees as a value between 90 and 90.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.Perspective
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 0 and 100 describing the depth appearance of the chart. The smallest value 0 is identical to having a parallel camera, and the largest value 100 produces the most exaggerated perspective, similar to what is produced with a wide-angle camera. This property has effect only if the PerspectiveEnabled property is true.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.PerspectiveEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the 3D perspective is enabled for the chart. If the property is false, the chart axes will be in right angle and the perspective effect is disabled.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.HeightPercentOfBase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 5 and 500 representing the percentage of the height of the chart compared against the length of the bottom of the chart on X axis. Height of 100 percent means the chart will be as high as it is wide. A 200 percent means the chart will be twice as high as it is wide. HeightPercentOfBase has effect only when Autoscale property is false.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.DepthPercentOfBase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 0 and 2000 representing the percentage of the depth of the 3D chart compared against the length of the bottom of the chart on X axis. Depth of 100 percent means the chart will be as deep as it is wide. A 200 percent means the chart will be twice as deep as it is wide.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartRotation3D.Autoscale
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the height percentage of the chart can be set independently of depth percentage. When this flag is true the height percentage is automatically calculated function of the depth percentage.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of charts in a worksheet

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the collection enumerator

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection.AddChart(ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartType)
member.summary: Use this type of constructor when the series will be manually added to the chart, otherwise use the constructor accepting the data source range parameter. Adds a new chart to the collection without specifying the data source range. The location and the size of the chart inside the worksheet are the default ones.
member.param: The chart type

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection.AddChart(ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this type of constructor when the series will be manually added to the chart, otherwise use the constructor accepting the data source range parameter. Adds a new chart to the collection without specifying the data source range. The location and the size of the chart inside the worksheet are specified by the left column, top row, right column and bottom row parameters.
member.param: The chart type
The one based left column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The left column is included in the chart area.
The one based top row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The top row is included in the chart area.
The one based right column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The right column is not included in the chart area.
The one based bottom row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The bottom row is not included in the chart area.

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection.AddChart(ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartType,ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new chart to the collection. The data source range of the chart is specified as the dataSourceRange parameter. The chart series are automatically generated from the data source. The location and the size of the chart inside the worksheet are the default ones.
member.param: The chart type
The data source range of the chart
When this parameter is true the chart series will be created from range rows, otherwise the chart series will be created from range columns.

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartsCollection.AddChart(ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartType,ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new chart to the collection. The data source range of the chart is specified as the dataSourceRange parameter. The chart series are automatically generated from the data source. The location and the size of the chart inside the worksheet are specified by the left column, top row, right column and bottom row parameters.
member.param: The chart type
The one based left column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The left column is included in the chart area.
The one based top row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The top row is included in the chart area.
The one based right column index of the chart area in the worksheet. The right column is not included in the chart area.
The one based bottom row index of the chart area in the worksheet. The bottom row is not included in the chart area.
The data source range of the chart
When this parameter is true the chart series will be created from range rows, otherwise the chart series will be created from range columns.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the MajorUnit is automatically selected. Default value is true. A change of the MajorUnit property will put this flag on false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value representing where the horizontal (category) axis crosses the vertical (value) axis.

member.summary: Gets or sets or a flag indicating that the horizontal (category) axis crosses the vertical (value) axis at the maximum value of the value axis.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.AutoCategoryAxisCross
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the value where the category axis crosses the value axis is automatically selected. Default value is true. A change of the CategoryAxisCrossesAt property will put this flag on false.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.DisplayUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit for the values on the value axis. The default value is None which means no scaling is used on the value axis. There are a few possible predefined display units like hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, etc for the value axis scaling. It is also possible to define a custom display unit. To set a custom value for the display unit the property should be set to CustomUnit and in this case the CustomDisplayUnit should be set to the desired unit value.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.CustomDisplayUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing a custom display unit as an alternative to the predefined display units (100, 1000, 10000, etc).

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.LogarithmicScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the value axis uses a logarithmic scale.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.LabelsPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the labels position on value axis. Default value is NextToAxis.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelChartValueAxis.LabelsRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle of the axis labels as a value between -90 and 90. A positive value will rotate the labels clockwise and the negative values will rotate the text counter-clockwise.

member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the minor grid lines are displayed in chart. The default value is true.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelDocumentSecurity
member.summary: Manage the document security like workbook structure and windows protection, open/write password protection.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelDocumentSecurity.OpenWorkbookPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the password that must be supplied to open the workbook when opening a workbook or to password protect the workbook when saving a workbook. Password protection works only with Excel 2003 .xls format. To remove password protection for an existing workbook a valid open password must be supplied when opening the workbook and then the OpenPassword property must be set to null before saving the workbook to prevent protecting again the saved document.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelDocumentSecurity.WriteWorkbookPassword
member.summary: Sets the write password of a workbook. This password is required in order to edit the workbook. Password protection works only with Excel 2003 .xls format.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hyperlink type.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelHyperlink.Address
member.summary: The target address to which this hyperlink points. The target address can be a URL (e.g. 'http://www.mysite.com' or 'maito://support@mysite.com'), a file or folder in the file system (e.g. 'file://C:\MyFolder' or 'file://C:\MyFolder\MyFile.txt' or file://\\MyServer\MyFolder) or a range adress from the same worksheet or another worksheet (e.g. 'MySheet!A1' or 'A1:B2' ) function of the hyperlink type. When the address is a range address, the name of the range cannot contain white spaces. You can define a named range if the target worksheet name contains spaces.

member.param: The URL address to which this hyperlink points.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPageSetup.CenterFooterFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the center part of the footer. Formatting and VBA codes for headers and footers are below. &L - Left aligns the characters that follow. &C - Centers the characters that follow. &R - Right aligns the characters that follow. &E - Turns double-underline printing on or off. &X - Turns superscript printing on or off. &Y - Turns subscript printing on or off. &B - Turns bold printing on or off. &I - Turns italic printing on or off. &U - Turns underline printing on or off. &S - Turns strikethrough printing on or off. &"fontname" - Prints the characters that follow in the specified font. Be sure to include the double quotation marks. &nn - Prints the characters that follow in the specified font size. Use a two-digit number to specify a size in points. &color - Prints the characters in the specified color. User supplies a hexidecimal color value. &D - Prints the current date. &T - Prints the current time. &F - Prints the name of the document. &A - Prints the name of the workbook tab. &P - Prints the page number. &P+number - Prints the page number plus the specified number. &P-number - Prints the page number minus the specified number. && - Prints a single ampersand. &N - Prints the total number of pages in the document. &Z - Prints the file path. &G - Inserts an image.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPageSetup.CenterFooterPicture
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed in the center part of the footer.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPageSetup.LeftHeaderFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the left part of the header. Formatting and VBA codes for headers and footers are below. &L - Left aligns the characters that follow. &C - Centers the characters that follow. &R - Right aligns the characters that follow. &E - Turns double-underline printing on or off. &X - Turns superscript printing on or off. &Y - Turns subscript printing on or off. &B - Turns bold printing on or off. &I - Turns italic printing on or off. &U - Turns underline printing on or off. &S - Turns strikethrough printing on or off. &"fontname" - Prints the characters that follow in the specified font. Be sure to include the double quotation marks. &nn - Prints the characters that follow in the specified font size. Use a two-digit number to specify a size in points. &color - Prints the characters in the specified color. User supplies a hexidecimal color value. &D - Prints the current date. &T - Prints the current time. &F - Prints the name of the document. &A - Prints the name of the workbook tab. &P - Prints the page number. &P+number - Prints the page number plus the specified number. &P-number - Prints the page number minus the specified number. && - Prints a single ampersand. &N - Prints the total number of pages in the document. &Z - Prints the file path. &G - Inserts an image.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPageSetup.LeftHeaderPicture
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed in the left part of the header.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture
member.summary: Represents a picture in a worksheet.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.Worksheet
member.summary: Gets the worksheet of this picture.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.ImageObj
member.summary: Gets the System.Drawing.Image object.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.LeftColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based left column index of the picture in the worksheet. The left column is included in the picture area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.RightColumnIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based right column index of the picture area in the worksheet. The right column is not included in the picture area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.TopRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based top row index of the picture area in the worksheet. The top row is included in the picture area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.BottomRowIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the one based bottom row index of the picture area in the worksheet. The bottom row is not included in the picture area.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureLeftPositionPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the left edge of the picture area inside the worksheet. The left and right column indexes are adjusted based on the specified left position to keep the width. The left position is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureTopPositionPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the top edge of the picture area inside the worksheet. The top and bottom column indexes are adjusted based on the specified top position to keep the height. The top position is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureWidthPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the picture area. The right column index is adjusted based on the specified width. The width is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureHeightPx
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels (1 pixels is 1/96 inch) of the picture area. The bottom row index is adjusted based on the specified height. The height is measured in pixels. The dimensions can be converted from pixels to inches using the UnitsConverter class.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureLeftPositionPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the left edge of the picture area inside the worksheet. The left and right column indexes are adjusted based on the specified left position to keep the width.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureTopPositionPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the top edge of the picture area inside the worksheet. The top and bottom column indexes are adjusted based on the specified top position to keep the height.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureWidthPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the picture area width in points (1 point is 1/72 inch). The right column index is adjusted based on the specified width.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureHeightPoints
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in points (1 point is 1/72 inch) of the picture area. The bottom row index is adjusted based on the specified height.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PictureName
member.summary: Gets or sets the picture name in workbook. If no name was explicitly set then a default name will be generated for the picture when the workbook is saved.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicture.PicturePlacement
member.summary: Represents how the picture is attached to the cells below it. The default value is ExcelPicturePlacement.MoveDontSizeWithCells and the image will move with the cells, but it will not size with them.

member.name: T:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelPicturePlacement

member.summary: Gets a merged Range object containing the specified cell or null if the specified cell is not part of a merged range

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell value as an object. The setter will determine the value type (Boolean, DateTime or Number) from the specified object type. If it's not one these types range will be set with a Text value. If you simply want to set the range with a text you can use the Text property of the Range object. If you want to set a range with a formula string you can use the Formula or FormulaArray properties. If you want to set a range with an Error value you can use the ErrorValue property. If you want to disable the parsing of the string values and simply set the cell value to the specified string you can set ExcelWorksheet.ParseValueString = false.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the string value of the range. Returns null if the cell does not contain text or the text is not the same in all the range cells.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.NumberValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the number value of the range. Returns Double.Nan if the range cells don't contain a number or the number value is not the same in all the cells. Setting this property has the same effect as setting the Value property with a Double value.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.DateTimeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the DateTime value of the range. Returns DateTime.MinValue if the range cells don't contain a DateTime or the DateTime value is not the same in all the cells. Setting this property has the same effect as setting the Value property with a DateTime value.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.BooleanValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the boolean value of the range. Returns false if the range cells don't contain a boolean value or the boolean value is not the same in all the cells. Setting this property has the same effect as setting the Value property with a Boolean value.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.ErrorValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the error of this range. Returns null if the range cells don't contain an error value or the error value is not the same in all the cells. When this property is set with a string value which is not an error string an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.AutofitColumns
member.summary: Changes the width of the range columns to achieve the best fit for the cells content.

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.AutofitRows
member.summary: Changes the height of the range rows to achieve the best fit for the cells content.

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.FreezePanes
member.summary: Freezes panes to keep row and column labels visible when the worksheet is scrolled. To lock rows select the row below where you want the freeze to appear (e.g. The range "A5" will freeze the rows from 1 to 4). To lock columns select the column to the right of where you want the split to appear (e.g. The range "D1" will freeze the columns A, B and C). To lock both rows and columns select the cell below and to the right of where you want the split to appear (e.g. The range "D5" will freeze the rows from 1 to 4 and the columns A, B and C).

member.name: M:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.AddComment(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the comment with the specified text to this range. The range is expected to contain a single cell otherwise the comment will be placed on the top left cell of the range.
member.param: The comment text.
member.returns: The comment object attached to the range.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelRange.Comment
member.summary: Gets the comment of this range or null if no comment was assigned to this range. The range is expected to contain a single cell otherwise the comment of the top left cell of the range will be returned.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelWorkbook.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the Excel workbook format (Excel 97-2003 .xls or Excel 2007-2019 or above .xlsx). This property gives the output format when the workbook is saved and controls the features allowed when the workbook is updated by the library. When creating an empty workbook the format is Excel 97-2003. When the workbook is created from an existing excel file or stream, the format is the format of the opened excel document.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelWorkbookDefaultSettings.FullTrustAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a global flag indicating if the ASP.NET Full Trust level can be granted to the library at runtime. This property has effect only if AutoTrustLevel is false. The default value is true and therefore the library assumes it can run in full trust mode. In full trust mode the library can run some speed optimizations to deliver the best performance. Full Trust level is the default level assigned by ASP.NET to the web applications.

member.name: P:ExpertXls.ExcelLib.ExcelWorkbookDefaultSettings.AutoTrustLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indication if the library should automatically determine the trust level in an ASP.NET environment in order to offer the best performance. Default value is true. When this property is false the trust level is given by the FullTrustAllowed property.
